title: Australia‚Äôs EEZ
abstract: The extent of the national study was the region 90o‚Äì 180oE and 0o‚Äì60oS.
description: Associated digital data that have demonstrated utility towards recognising and defining areas of high biodiversity value (‚Äòhotspots‚Äô) with recent collections (of a subset of 721 ‚Äòsurrogate‚Äô species) and Western Australian Museum has produced a significant database of c.3,800 ‚Äòspecies‚Äô (OTUs) from c.4,000 localities. Point specimen data of the ‚Äòsurrogate‚Äô species are accompanied by modelled geographic.

title: Australia‚Äôs deepwater demersal fish fauna
abstract: These maps enabled visual interpretation of species‚Äô ranges and prevalence
description: The aims of the project were:‚Ä¢ to locate, identify and collate existing information on the nature and distribution of marine sediments within the Australian Marine Jurisdiction;‚Ä¢ to develop the MARS sediments database within Geoscience Australia and populate it with collated data to provide a national fundamental dataset, with publicly-available data;‚Ä¢ to analyse and map readily available sediment data for the Northern Planning Area as a first priority to provide information for the Northern Region marine bioregionalisation;‚Ä¢ to analyse and map an agreed selection of sediment data for the Australian region to provide information for the National Benthic Marine Bioregionalisation;‚Ä¢ to detail in maps estimates of sediment mobilisation due to waves and tidal currents for Australian waters less than 300 m depth;‚Ä¢ to strategically analyse the role of sediments and other seafloor characteristics information in marine bioregionalisations and, based on an assessment of relative benefits, recommend options for further research and data collection; and‚Ä¢ to interact with the National Marine Bioregionalisation Integration project teams to ensure sediments and other seafloor characteristics information is applied correctly in the National Benthic Marine Bioregionalisation.
